Reviews.Title: “Business in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Debbie K
Reviews.Content: This is a quirky old hotel but of the highest quality. Nice restaurant on site. Very quiet location. Rooms comfortable and well equipped.

Reviews.Title: “Standard hotel and a little old fashioned”
Reviews.Author: RuAlAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times when I visited Berlin on business. It is clean and well maintained. The rooms are small but functional. The bed is comfortable and as in most German hotels the pillows soft and the comforter light. The hotel does not have air conditioning so the room can be quite warm in the summer even if you open the window. The bathroom is functional as is the squeeze soap and shampoo (all-in-one) dispenser in the bath/shower. The high speed wireless internet works well and is included in our company rate. Looking at the rate card it is quite expensive for access. The views from the rooms are splendid with all rooms looking over the park and the Leitzensee (a small lake). The breakfast is very good and the service friendly. There are plenty of restaurants close to the hotel for a pleasant meal in the evening without having to go far.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, good location if in Berlin for conference alone”
Reviews.Author: SporeTripper
Reviews.Content: Stay here as a conference hotel is fine. Clean small room with no fancy amenities. Breakfast buffet is good. 10 min walk to the ICC conference hall. No free wifi or internet connection. Probably you would prefer to stay in another hotel at the Ku'damm area (the bus M49 conveniently runs between ICC and the Zoo station in Ku'damm), especially if spouse is accompanying you on your conference trip, so that spouse would have had more convenient access to malls and conveniences.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: Alexejbg
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Seehof Berlin for five days during my business trip to Berlin. Hotel is located in Charlottenburg, a peaceful part of Berlin, just a few minutes away from Berlin's Fair. On the shore of small lake Lietzensee, it is very romantic and perfect for those who want to combine business with pleasure. Relaxing in sauna or in swimming pool is excellent way to spend an evening after a busy work day. Rooms are very clean and most of them with the lake view. For Internet addicts, there is a wireless connection but it is extra charged. On the first flor, there are sauna, solarium and swimming pool which are free of charge for hotel guests. I strongly recommend all of it. :)) Next to the restaurant, there is a small, but a very nice bar.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Kee66
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel near the ICC and about 300 metres from a U-bahn station. Very friendly staff, very comfortable rooms, fabulous facilities (e.g. swimming pool), and the restaurant was really good. It was excellent value. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Cute Hotel - Nicest Staff Ever”
Reviews.Author: Fearghas
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. The staff were the friendliest of any place I've ever stayed and it's obvious that they're happy in their work and treated well. I really commend the management on this point. The dining room is lovely with high ceilings, really comfortable seats and massive windows looking out over the terrace and lake. The lake itself is quite pretty with plenty of mature trees surrounding it giving a nice view for a city hotel. Most of the bedrooms look out onto this lake which is another bonus. The dinner is absolutely outstanding with everything cooked from scratch (no nuking goes on here). I believe the single rooms are tiny so beware when booking - I had a double which I was very pleased with. The pool is small but it's not so small that you can't use it for exercise; there's a good sauna in the leisure centre too along with the most amazing power showers that give wonderful massages. It's quite close to the ICC which is convenient for business travellers and there's a supermarket called 'Kaiser's' two blocks away and about 6 or 7 very reasonable and recommended restaurants all within a 5 minute walk. There's a bus that brings you into the action (Number 100) about 60 seconds from the front of the hotel. The S-bahn and the U-Bahn are a little further away - approx 10 min walk. On the downside the wireless connection wasn't great in my room - it was a very weak signal that cut out quite a bit. The bar is a bit pokey and not very nice but they have a pretty good selection of beers, spirits and cocktails. This is a Ring Hotel and when I go back to Germany I will definitely consider staying at a hotel in this chain because I have not felt so comfortable in a hotel in a long time.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel just outside the centre”
Reviews.Author: Coffe_N
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Seehof Hotel between 19-20 of April 2007 and I paid 99 euro including breakfast. WiFi is about another 12 euro extra a day. As the hotel had a four star ranking outside, I think the price was very, very reasonable. The hotel is located in a residential area and is very quiet and feels very safe. The location within Berlin is so-so as there is about 8-9 stops on the subway (less than 1 km away) until you are in the centre and in the local neighbourhood there isn’t too much to see. The exterior of the hotel gives you a sudden feeling of something that has ran away from east Berlin but don’t let that fool you. The hotel is located just by a small lake (big pond) and has a terrace overlooking the lake. Unfortunately, the weather didn’t offer any terrace sitting opportunities. The check-in was quick and the staff (which goes for all the staff) was polite but efficient. The rooms are medium sized with a large bed (120 cm) which was VERY comfortable, one of the best I have had in a hotel ever. The room was very clean and all supplies hade been well stocked. Personally, I don’t like this kind of room interior as I prefer more modern decoration instead of dark wood and carpeting. But that is just a matter of personal opinion so I don’t take that into consideration when reviewing. There is a TV set with a whole bunch of German TV channels which basically means you won’t watch any TV. The hotel restaurant is fair but slightly overpriced in my opinion and I have had much better meals in Germany for less. Though I would like to point out that the service is good and the kitchen is lightning-fast. Unfortunately we couldn’t try the cocktail bar as the cocktail waitress seemed to have run away but there is a cocktail bar at least. Breakfast was good but nothing extraordinary. Given the price it was a good experience if you not are looking for a central Berlin hotel. My grade is something between a strong three and a weak four but I go for the four as the price was good and I hade a very nice night of sleep in a quiet room and an extremely comfy bed.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of Calm”
Reviews.Author: pablot
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Seehof for 3 nights when on business in Berlin. Rooms were on the small side but have everything you want as well as being immauculatley clean. They had an extensive menu and the food was excellent. What was also a real treat was the lovely outside patio that overlooked a small lake, very calming and relaxing after a busy day. One thing I would pick out for special mention was the the staff...they were absolutley superb. Nothing was too much trouble, their English was excellent and every one had a smile on their faces. The reason I stayed here was becasue all the 5 star hotels were full for a big trade fair in town, the reasons I will return are obvious.

HotelInfo.Name: Seehof Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Lietzensee-Ufer 11, 14057 Berlin, Germany
